children.name: depict
children.definition: represent by a drawing, painting, or other art form.
examples: paintings depicting Old Testament scenes
these equations may be depicted on a graph
Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century.
[ + -ing verb]People were shocked by the advertisement which depicted a woman beating her husband.
depict sb/sth as
The god is depicted as a bird with a human head.
depiction[C or U] the way that sth is represented or shown
The painter's depictionsofthe horror of war won her a worldwide reputation.
I disapprove of the depictionofviolence on television.

children.name: portray
children.definition: to describe sb or sth in a painting, film, book, or other artistic work:
examples: The painting portrays a beautiful young woman in a blue dress.
The writer portrays life in a small village at the turn of the century.
portray sb/ sth as
The father in the film is portrayed as a fairly unpleasant character.
Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
portrayal[C or U] the way sb or sth is described or shown in a book, film, play etc
portrayal of
the newspapers’ portrayal of Islamic culture
His latest movie is a grim portrayal of wartime suffering.
accurate/realistic etc portrayal

children.name: The film is not an accurate portrayal
examples: of his life.

children.name: represent
children.definition: if a painting, statue , piece of music etc represents sth or sb, it shows them : mô tả
examples: Paintings representing religious themes were common in medieval times.
[ + -ing]The statue represents St George killingthe dragon.
This new report represents the current situation in our schools.
representation[U] C2 the act of representing sb or sth
representation of
She received praise for her effective representation of Garcia during the trial.
He gave a talk on the representation of women in 19th-century art.
representation[C] a painting, sign, description etc that shows something
representation of
The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.

children.name: to succeed in or represent sth
capture
children.definition: to succeed in or describing sth very accurately using words or images : lột tả được
examples: It would be impossible to capture her beauty in a painting.
These photographs capture the essence of working-class life at the turn of the century.
These photographs capture the essence of working-class life at the turn of the century.

children.name: stylized
children.definition: / stylisedUK  represented in an artificial style that does not look natural or real, but that is still pleasant to look at : kiểu cách hóa, cách điệu
examples: stylization[U]

children.name: a stylized picture of the sun
examples: The rock drawings depict a variety of stylized human, bird and mythological figures and patterns.

children.name: perspective
children.definition: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture : phép phối cảnh, thu phóng không gian
examples: the artist’s use of perspective
In 15th-century Italy, artists rediscovered the rules of perspective.
in perspective[PP]an object or person that is in perspective has the correct size and position in comparison with other things in the picture : đúng phối cảnh

out of perspective [PP] an object or person that is out of perspective does not have the correct size or position in comparison with other thingsin the picture, and therefore does not look real or natural : không đúng phối cảnh
